document.title: Major changes between ISE Eiffel 5.4 and ISE Eiffel 5.5

list.item: Full support for new convert keyword.
Made Void, previously a feature of ANY, a keyword. This prevents the renaming of Void into not_void previously possible when it was a routine of ANY.
Added support for reference and expanded constraints on a formal generic parameter.
Reduced, in classic mode, size of finalized executables by 10 to 50%.
Improved speed of evaluation of global onces by having a lock-free mechanism when a once has been evaluated.
In multithreaded mode, fixed dead lock on Unix plaforms when evaluating global onces.
Removed obsolete eifcid, eif_expand and eifexp from the CECIL interface, one has to use eif_type_id instead.

Fixed issue about conformance checking of type containing a formal generic parameter. We would always evaluate the formal to its constraint, thus allowing the code below to be accepted where it should not have been:
class A [G] feature bug is local l_any: LIST [ANY] l_g: LIST [G] do l_any := l_g l_g := l_any end
